title: The elder dragon execute outright invalidates champions such as Warwick and Olaf.
body:
Or any champion who does good withLast Stand with the only exception being Tryndamere.

It invalidates taking Last stand and makes Dark Harvest way more powerful than it should be. Nobody in their right minds would want to see this change go live.

replies.body: The elder dragon execute is a r%%%%%ed change. Games already end fast enough. Nobody needs an elder dragon execute to end games.

> [{quoted}](name=Hayaishi2,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=PvrH7Twh,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2019-10-27T17:38:34.663+0000)
>
> The elder dragon execute is a r%%%%%ed change. Games already end fast enough. Nobody needs an elder dragon execute to end games.

? if ur the best at taking dragons.  the earliest you can get the soul/4 dragon kills is 25 minutes. meaning elder can spawn AT THE FASTEST 30 mins into game. if you lost 4 dragons and elder 30 mins into a game, you deserve to lose.   change my mind
I think his point is that because games are designed to be quicker now, it'll make comebacks impossible if a team is ahead (or to bring back a lead) due to executes,

But it takes a lot of time for elder to even spawn. One team needs 4 dragons before it can spawn, which means if you manage to take even one dragon, you effectively delayed the elder spawn by at least 5 minutes. And the execute doesn't seem to happen from very high health. They also nerfed the true damage burn the buff does so i bet if you calculate the damage lost from the burn and add the execute's worth of damage, they go pretty much even or it could even be a nerf to the buff's overall damage.

The elder dragon spawns after the average game length anyway so it can't be blamed for lack of comebacks.
An execute would be a huge nerf to sustain champs regardless.
It's actually a bigger deal for non-sustain champions. A sustain champion can avoid the execute thresh hold with their sustain but others can't.

See, while that sounds true, sustain champs are balanced around barely sticking around. For them they may drop below and above that threshold multiple times in a standard game, but elder cuts that off on the first time.

Literally none of the sustain champions are balanced around that and pretty much none of them commonly drop below that health threshold. And you have to consider how much it matters at that point in the game. Champions like ww, aatrox and olaf die anyway at that hp at that point in the game. Vlad doesn't drop that low easily and he also dies if he does because the damage he takes at that point is very high. The execute doesn't happen at high hp. It happens when the champion is pretty mcuh dead anyway. At least champions like vlad can sustain themselves so they are less likely to drop to that threshold than other champions. The sustain doesn't matter at very low hp.

Weird, I thought it became impossible to snowball because of the bounty system… Wonder where the truth lies…
{{sticker:sg-lux-2}}

Here's something you 200iq players don't understand. **Whether your team gets to take dragons or not is highly dependent on how skilled your jungle and bot laners are.**

If you've got a r%%%%%ed bot lane where the ADC dies 5 times in the laning phase or an afk farming jungler, you're going to have an even harder time carrying that game despite doing incredibly well by yourself. Bot lane and jungle already decides games and the Elder drake execute isn't helping make things any better.
Your ability to take dragon is highly dependent on the skill of 60% of your team? Damn who knew?

Want to add to this that, the rift herald will spawn twice if she is killed early. I think games are going to be way quicker if team team start doing 10-12min rift heralds because Shelly will spawn again and Baron will truly be game enders as team capitalize on sieging and turret plates where first shelly will likely be used for turret plats and the second shelly to siege into inhib. The new meta means that since objectives are extremely important you have to pick champions who have early power spike, do good damage in early game and have strong lane priority and waveclear. Thus, games will be explosive, full of kills and shorter and champions may get items faster through the sieges and teamfights rather than old style of league..
I personally love this new league version 2.0. Some people (people who have time, may prefer the old way of league).

 So it is not only going to be lane swaps and dragon/bot lane meta. Therefore, elder dragon is truly late game. And i am 100% sure in solo queue this does not make a difference because before there was true damage anyway. The execute is just a visual effect change if you look at it without the math.
Lol is moving towards esports business and games will average around 24 minutes next season. I am 100% sure.
You literally need 4 drakes to be taken by a single team before Elder spawns. At that point, having a "hard finish" objective makes sense.
warwick and olaf both are already invalidated by the time elder spawns
Dr Mundo pops ult and instantly dies to execute because he just lost 30% of his health.

Nope.
The prerequisite for Elder buff execute is to at least do the damage to the champion. Champions naturally getting away from a fight under this threshold and possibly deciding to jungle and lose a bit of HP, won't suddenly die to Elder spit from diagonal League away.

> [{quoted}](name=Tomoe Gozen,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=PvrH7Twh,comment-id=00160001,timestamp=2019-10-28T11:16:05.898+0000)
>
> Nope.
> The prerequisite for Elder buff execute is to at least do the damage to the champion. Champions naturally getting away from a fight under this threshold and possibly deciding to jungle and lose a bit of HP, won't suddenly die to Elder spit from diagonal League away.

You understand Mundo R is something you pop during a teamfight right?  You don't use it randomly in the jungle.

And you're not gonna pop Mundo's ult at 5% of his HP either.
Because at that time, the damage the enemy team deals to you will likely outpace your mega regen anyway and you'd be dead with your ult on CD.

> [{quoted}](name=Tomoe Gozen,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=PvrH7Twh,comment-id=0016000100000000,timestamp=2019-10-28T14:45:32.660+0000)
>
> And you're not gonna pop Mundo's ult at 5% of his HP either.
> Because at that time, the damage the enemy team deals to you will likely outpace your mega regen anyway and you'd be dead with your ult on CD.

Popping Mundo's ult is 25%

You're likely going to use it if you approach half

So best case you've got maybe 70% health, its clear a fight is going to start, and you press the button for speed and hp.  If you get caught though, do you doubt that people in a 5 man can't pile on the remaining 45% hp in a couple seconds to reach execute threshold?  Burst is Mundo's weakness and something like that just deletes him if he's not ahead.  

I don't remember off hand the execute threshold, but even at 5-15% that makes Mundo easier to get rid of.  If your gimmick is being hard to kill and the game just makes killing everyone easier, its worse for the tankier champions than the squishies already being oneshot.
i think what your saying is that this change is a indirect nerf to those champ types who thrive off of near death status..
Nobody mentioned Volibear passive yet?
The champ is invalidated anyway at that point in the game.

You realize how often you are not going to see this dragon? If its strong just lower the threshold, elder does not spawn not until 1 team has 4 dragons so at that point someone is probably already winning hard enough.
Although one problem I could see is if dragon cheeser jgs were picked (ones that can do it solo and really early). They will get a buff out of the camp respawn timers being decreased to 2 mins.

It also invalidates Kled... Half of his kit is based on remounting (his health returning, his E and his ult) to get his stuff back and remount, he has to be at low health for a while. No doubt this will make the team with this dragon run him over.
I guess I'll have to wait and see.
Kled has two health bars, so if he's at 4k total hp with say 800 base and 3200 skarrl, he's executed at 80 for 10%, not 400.
Wrong, Kled counts for his entire health bar. You can ask SoulMario, a challenger one trick kled, about that.
We know for a FACT that you are wrong about this.
urgot ult executes him for 25% of his entire hp bar, rather than for 25% of kled's hp bar iirc
I have to inform you that you aren't remembering that correctly. It's 25% from kled's hp bar.

Aatrox Airlines IS correct, as I posted above, here is some footage from last week: https://youtu.be/XoOgxwCNptc?t=920 

Keep in mind, Kled has JUST gotten his black cleaver. If he also had titanic he would have been executed even earlier in dismount form. As you can see, Kled is at about HALF of the small bar. This means Kleds health bar just has a split.
Well we still don't know if that will be the case for elder dragon.

Tbh I don't understand why Riot gets their dick hard on executes. Everything is changed to be an execute. For example why the hell Veigar ulti is an execute? It used to scale based on enemy AP and now it scales on missing health. Veigar is not supposed to be an assassin.
every sweeping change to the game ever since plants were first introduced has been to make league feel more like a mobile game
{{champion:30}} + {{item:3151}} ult straight up gonna execute someone at 1.5k hp lmfao
Then you should make sure the enemy doesn't get it.

> [{quoted}](name=Moody P,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=PvrH7Twh,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2019-10-27T18:16:24.441+0000)
>
> Then you should make sure the enemy doesn't get it.

Thats actually very stupid xD. Its as stupid as the counterplay "stay out of range".

The flat stats the dragon gave you previously is now gone. 

The change is a nerf in the right direction.

I don't see a problem here. If elder drake is on the map and is able to be taken then the game has gone for quite a while. using a rune this late in the game doesn't really seem right as the adc should be full build dealing most if not all the damage meaning if you didn't build tank you "should" die to those adcs. And for building tank you probably wont be dealing any amazing damage expect for staying alive. The elderdrake is looking like it will end games faster so if your giving up a game ending buff then you are probably going to lose regardless of what champ and runes you took. I mean i could always be wrong so im open to talk about it.
Can we get a League of Legends Vanilla edition after this season goes through?  I don't know...roll it back to season 6-ish?

That also means it invalidates champions with executes themselves but in a meaningless way, since they won't have to use them. {{champion:122}} {{champion:555}} {{champion:86}} {{champion:28}} {{champion:6}} are some good examples.

Correct me if I'm wrong, but elder is at 10% hp.

Unless you have 5,6k hp, you really aren't invalidating them.

In the case of dairus, you can get your ult off earlier if you calculate correctly using elder, and still get resets.
Pyke can't use elder, but his execute threshhold is much much higher then elder is, so it's valid in terms of sharing gold & value still.

Garen doesn't have much of an execute? It's more raw damage then anything, also it still works as aforementioned with dairus, being an earlier execute threshold.

Eve doesn't mind it, still a higher exe threshold,

Urgot is at  around 25% hp iirc, 100% diffrent from 10%
Garen's ult is almost entirely %missing HP damage, y'know, the original definition of an execute.  In fact, its the strongest pure execute in the entire game.
Except it's not a "pure" execute because it has base damage. If you want to compare abilities that scale with missing health then veigar's ult is way more powerful than garen's against most targets.

Pure execute in the fact that its damage based on % missing health, scaling off of their health directly; as opposed to hybrid(or impure) executes like Riven's or Volibear's where it ostensibly scales off missing health, but only provides a %damage increase to its base damage based on the % of remaining HP of the target it's cast at. Veigar's is of course, in the same boat as Riven and Voli with an impure execute that does not do any % missing HP damage at all, but rather scales its own base damage and scaling from 175 / 250 / 325 (+ 75% AP) at a target with 100% HP to 350 / 500 / 650 (+ 150% AP) to a target with 33.33% or less HP.
Would u still get the reset as darius?

Yeah having 4 dragons right now? Yeah, you NEVER win those games and have a very big chance of coming back. That elder dragon execute that spawns AT THE EARLIEST 30 MINUTES toooootallly gonna ruin the champs that fall off around 25 anyway. I really can't fathom why riot doesn't listen to the boards...

I think I've seen exactly one Elder Dragon being taken this season in my games. I highly doubt the elder dragon change will have any noticeable impact on their winrates.

Warwick has pretty good neutral monster control with his extremely high sustain and massive attack speed once it gets to 50% HP AND the ability to suppress the enemy jungler when he jumps into the pit to try to smite. If anything Warwick wants neutral monsters to be more important.

Olaf is so snowbally and falls off so badly, if you're at 35 mins and you don't already have a big enough lead to have full control of dragon by this point in the game you may as well /ff

If they do put it through, it should have a very strict limit. Such as not being too strong, (aka executing when your health isn't that low, or being true damage that ignores things such as shields), or not being a constant reset that lets you execute again and again, and only 1 execute per champion and then it goes on a long cooldown.



Edit: Saw the clip of a Jinx getting an insta penta from it, my God this shit is unfair, it makes it such a one-sided winfor the team with the more/better drakes, regardless of how well the other team did, please don't put it on live server like this...

> [{quoted}](name=14daysuspensionk,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=PvrH7Twh,comment-id=001f,timestamp=2019-10-28T12:32:50.808+0000)
>
> If they do put it through, it should have a very strict limit. Such as not being too strong, (aka executing when your health isn't that low, or being true damage that ignores things such as shields), or not being a constant reset that lets you execute again and again, and only 1 execute per champion and then it goes on a long cooldown.
> 
> 
> 
> Edit: Saw the clip of a Jinx getting an insta penta from it, my God this shit is unfair, it makes it such a one-sided winfor the team with the more/better drakes, regardless of how well the other team did, please don't put it on live server like this...

WOW! a highlight clip making something seem broken? Who knew anybody could ever do that? 

Seriously if seeing one clip changes your mind on something you should probably stop playing the game because you must think everything is broken.
